page.title: 06Sonvelsby Area
page.content: Crops such as wheat, sugar beet and cabbage are grown here. Horses, ponies, sheep, cows and deer are found. There are many deciduous trees in small coppices. They could once have been joined together to form a huge forest, but parts were cut down to make way for roads and fields. There is only one amenity, a post box. Sonvelsby Court was built in 1575 and has 14 rooms. It is the second house to be built the first was burnt down.The court has some stained glass windows and some valuable treasures. The park is 1600 acres. Black fallow deer have been kept for 300-400 years in addition to the 30 cows and 1000 sheep. There is a mound which was the old refrigerator. Ice from the moat was stored there to keep food cool. It was linked by passage to the kitchen. There are fish in the moat.
